content: The Act may be cited as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act". It includes definitions for various terms. The Act, also known as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act", defines terms such as elementary school, local educational agency, secondary school, and State educational agency. It also outlines programs aimed at promoting healthy eating and nutrition education for students. These programs focus on enhancing students' ability to choose and consume healthy foods, understanding the influences on healthy eating, preparing them to make healthy decisions as adults, and using scientifically sound nutritional materials and methods. The Act, also known as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act", emphasizes the importance of providing education for students to make healthy eating decisions as adults. It includes using scientifically sound nutritional materials and methods supported by the Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Additionally, the Act includes professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service workers to promote a healthy school culture. Programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education are emphasized in the Act, also known as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act". This includes using scientifically sound nutritional materials and methods supported by the Dietary Guidelines for Americans, as well as professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service workers to promote a healthy school culture. Local educational agencies receiving assistance under Title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act must develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools. This includes integrating such programs throughout the school day, emphasizing knowledge of healthy foods like fresh fruits and vegetables. The curr_chunk emphasizes the use of educational materials and activities to promote knowledge of healthy foods, balanced diet, and physical activity among students. It also includes monitoring schools' efforts in improving nutrition understanding and healthy eating. The curr_chunk focuses on promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools by consulting with various stakeholders and organizations with expertise in nutrition education. The curr_chunk emphasizes collaborating with organizations and government authorities to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools. The curr_chunk focuses on agencies providing technical assistance for designing programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools, working with wellness councils, integrating programs with school wellness policies, and offering professional development in nutrition education. The Secretary of Education, Secretary of Agriculture, and the Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish a task force to review and recommend effective nutrition education programs for schools. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2014 through 2019 to support these efforts.
